div.h2: Welcome to South Holland School District
div.p:
It is our privilege and honor to partner with you in providing your child(ren) with the best possible education. We are committed to inspiring, engaging, educating, and empowering every student and it is an honor to be entrusted with this work.
Dr. Denise Julius
Superintendent
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________
IMPORTANT Grab & Go Meal INFORMATION:
Grab & Go meals will be available for pickup at Greenwood School - DOOR 6 from 10:00 - NOON on CERTAIN DAYS during the period of March 17th - April 30th, 2020. Children ages 0-18 years are eligible.
IMPORTANT UPDATE:
Meals will not be served April 10 through April 17.
They will continue on April 20 through April 30.
PLEASE READ the attached letter and flyer for important information on dates/times that you can come to Greenwood School to pick up the Grab & Go meals
IMPORTANT Parent/Guardian Letter
IMPORTANT Flyer on dates/times for pick up

strong.span: Transforming Educational Visions into Successful Realities

p.span: November 15, 2019, is the official statewide observance of School Board Members Day in Illinois. This honorary day is an opportunity for staff, parents/guardians and community/business members to show appreciation for our Board of Education and its commitment to providing a unified voice and direction for the district’s educational vision and mission.

South Holland District 150 School Board Members continue to “transform educational visions into successful realities” by considering the hopes and thoughts expressed by our parents, community/business members and staff. This Board continues to create educational opportunities and pathways leading to successful learning experiences for each child, every day, in every classroom. District 150’s School Board Members serve the public as unpaid volunteers for the benefit of all students within our community. They dedicate a significant amount of their own personal time to this district by attending regularly scheduled and special meetings, extracurricular events, participating in professional development opportunities, and working long hours to ensure all students have access to educational resources and academic supports needed to become successful learning. Thriving communities have successful schools that prepare all students to become college and career ready and hopefully, they will make positive contributions to their community and positively impact the local economy.
On behalf of the South Holland School District 150’s administrative team, staff, students, families and
community/business members, we salute and thank our Board members for their hard work, ongoing support, commitment and dedication to the district and community!

strong.span:
School Registration 2019-20
Residency Verification Information
Click the image above for full details.

p.span: On October 31, 2018, The Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) released designations for every school in the state. The designations provide a public benchmark of each school’s progress toward the goal of preparing all students for success in college and career. South Holland School District's Greenwood Elementary, McKinley Elementary, and McKinley Junior High were all designated as commendable for the 2017-2018 school year.
The designation is based on the school’s overall data for all of the accountability indicators, as well as the data for individual student groups.
